did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: Italian architect Gae Aulenti's ability to transform historic public buildings into museum spaces is documented by newspaper and magazine articles, biographical information, and her conceptual computer-drawn designs for the Asian Art Museum in San Francisco, California.
did.origination: Milka Bliznakov, Lois Gottlieb, and the Asian Art Museum

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Gae Aulenti Collection must be obtained from the Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite the collection should include the following information: Gae Aulenti Collection, Ms2000-014, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Gae Aulenti Collection materials were donated to the International Archive of Women in Architecture at the Special Collections by architects Milka Bliznakov and Lois Gottlieb, and by the Asian Art Museum of San Francisco in 2000, 2003, and 2005.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was arranged in 2000, and was processed and encoded in 2003. In 2006, the collection was reprocessed and the finding aid was updated to accomodate the addition of new items.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Gae Aulenti was born in Italy in 1929. She graduated from Facola di Architecttua-Politencico in Milan in 1954. Her career, spanning 1955 to the present, includes work on architecture, furniture, and interior design projects. Her publications are numerous, as are her awards and honors.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains biographical materials and documentation of Aulenti's work converting a 1917 former public library building in San Francisco, California into the Asian Art Museum, Chong-Moon Lee Center for Asian Art and Culture. Biographical inforamtion includes a 1989 curriculum vitae and some articles about her work. Asian Art Museum materials include articles about the construction of the museum, materials relating to the museum's 2003 opening, and forty print-outs of design drawings (some in color) showing proposed before-and-after views of the building's exterior and floor plans.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Aulenti collection is arranged by content and by format.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
